intro: Senecio tepopanus, commonly known as the Mexican ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, spiny seed capsules. Senecio tepopanus is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
